alert.note: Alert for Harney County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:59PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harney and northwestern Malheur Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 159 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Castle Rock, or 46 miles southeast of John Day, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Castle Rock and Beulah Reservoir around 300 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
